Uses of Class
org.forgerock.openam.sts.STSPublishException

  • Packages that use STSPublishException 
    Package Description
    org.forgerock.openam.sts
    Base package for classes shared between the SOAP and REST STS.
    org.forgerock.openam.sts.publish
    The classes in this package pertain to persisting the configuration state of published STS instances, so that they may be reconstituted following a server restart.
    org.forgerock.openam.sts.publish.common  
    org.forgerock.openam.sts.publish.rest  
    org.forgerock.openam.sts.publish.soap  
    org.forgerock.openam.sts.soap.publish
    Contains the classes related to publishing STS instances.
    org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.state
    The classes in this package pertain to pulling and caching sts-instance state from the SMS, and the registration of ServiceListeners to invalidate cache entries when SMS contents change.

    • Uses of STSPublishException in org.forgerock.openam.sts.publish

      Methods in org.forgerock.openam.sts.publish that throw STSPublishException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<T> STSInstanceConfigStore.getAllPublishedInstances()
      This method will be called by some startup context in the {locally|remotely} deployed {REST|SOAP} STS context to obtain all of the previously-published STS instances.
      List<T> STSInstanceConfigStore.getPublishedInstances(String realm)
      This method will be called by some startup context in the remotely deployed SOAP STS context to obtain all of the previously-published soap STS instances for a given realm, as a soap-sts deployment is specific to a given realm.
      T STSInstanceConfigStore.getSTSInstanceConfig(String stsId, String realm)
      This method is called by the token generation service to obtain the STS-instance specific configurations - notably the SAML2Config and the KeystoreConfig - which allows it to issue STS-instance-specific tokens.
      boolean STSInstanceConfigStore.isInstancePresent(String stsId, String realm)
      This method returns whether STS instance config referenced by the realm and id is present in the SMS.
      void STSInstanceConfigStore.persistSTSInstance(String stsId, String realm, T instance)
      Called by the RestSTSInstancePublisherImpl class to persist the configuration corresponding to the published STS instance
      void STSInstanceConfigStore.removeSTSInstance(String stsId, String realm) 
      void STSInstanceConfigStore.updateSTSInstance(String stsInstanceId, String realm, T instance)
      Updates attributes corresponding to the existing STS instance.

    • Uses of STSPublishException in org.forgerock.openam.sts.publish.common

      Methods in org.forgerock.openam.sts.publish.common that throw STSPublishException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<T> STSInstanceConfigStoreBase.getAllPublishedInstances() 
      List<T> STSInstanceConfigStoreBase.getPublishedInstances(String realm) 
      T STSInstanceConfigStoreBase.getSTSInstanceConfig(String stsInstanceId, String realm)
      Returns the STSInstanceConfig subclass corresponding to the stsInstanceId parameter.
      boolean STSInstanceConfigStoreBase.isInstancePresent(String stsId, String realm) 
      void STSInstanceConfigStoreBase.persistSTSInstance(String stsInstanceId, String realm, T instance)
      Persists the STS instance into the SMS.
      void STSInstanceConfigStoreBase.removeSTSInstance(String stsInstanceId, String realm)
      Removes the sts instance corresponding to the id from the SMS.
      void STSInstanceConfigStoreBase.updateSTSInstance(String stsInstanceId, String realm, T instance)
      Updates attributes corresponding to the existing STS instance.

    • Uses of STSPublishException in org.forgerock.openam.sts.publish.rest

      Methods in org.forgerock.openam.sts.publish.rest that throw STSPublishException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      RestSTSInstanceConfig RestSTSInstancePublisher.getPublishedInstance(String stsId, String realm)
      Called to return the config state corresponding to a specified Rest STS instance
      RestSTSInstanceConfig RestSTSInstancePublisherImpl.getPublishedInstance(String stsId, String realm) 
      List<RestSTSInstanceConfig> RestSTSInstancePublisher.getPublishedInstances()
      Called to obtain the configuration elements corresponding to previously-published STS instances.
      List<RestSTSInstanceConfig> RestSTSInstancePublisherImpl.getPublishedInstances() 
      boolean RestSTSInstancePublisher.isInstancePersistedInSMS(String stsId, String realm)
      Determines whether the Rest STS instance identified by the stsId is present in the SMS.
      boolean RestSTSInstancePublisherImpl.isInstancePersistedInSMS(String stsId, String realm) 
      String RestSTSInstancePublisher.publishInstance(RestSTSInstanceConfig instanceConfig, RestSTS instance, boolean republish)
      Publish the Rest STS instance specified by the instanceConfig parameter.
      String RestSTSInstancePublisherImpl.publishInstance(RestSTSInstanceConfig instanceConfig, RestSTS restSTSInstance, boolean republish)
      Publishes the rest STS instance at the specified relative path.
      void RestSTSInstancePublisher.removeInstance(String stsId, String realm, boolean removeOnlyFromRouter)
      Remove the Rest STS instance from the SMS, and from the CREST router.
      void RestSTSInstancePublisherImpl.removeInstance(String stsId, String realm, boolean removeOnlyFromRouter)
      Removes the published rest-sts instance at the specified stsId.
      void RestSTSInstancePublisher.republishExistingInstances()
      Called by the RestSTSRepublishServlet upon startup to re-publish previously-published Rest STS instances.
      void RestSTSInstancePublisherImpl.republishExistingInstances()
      This method is only to be called by the RestSTSSetupListener, which calls it only to re-publish previously-published Rest STS instances during OpenAM startup.
      void RestSTSInstancePublisher.updateInstanceInCrestRouter(String stsId, String realm, RestSTSInstanceConfig instanceConfig, RestSTS instance)
      Called by RestSTSPublishServiceListener in response to modify events.
      void RestSTSInstancePublisherImpl.updateInstanceInCrestRouter(String stsId, String realm, RestSTSInstanceConfig instanceConfig, RestSTS instance)
      The method is synchronized so that two instances are not updated concurrently, as multiple configurations must be completed atomically.
      void RestSTSInstancePublisher.updateInstanceInSMS(String stsId, String realm, RestSTSInstanceConfig instanceConfig, RestSTS instance)
      Called by RestSTSPublishServiceRequestHandler#handleUpdate, which is ultimately called by the AdminUI when an existing rest-sts instance is edited, or via a programmatic PUT to sts-publish/rest.
      void RestSTSInstancePublisherImpl.updateInstanceInSMS(String stsId, String realm, RestSTSInstanceConfig instanceConfig, RestSTS instance)
      The method is synchronized primarily as a sanity check, as excluding concurrent updates to published rest-sts instance state makes the system easier to reason about.
